Introduction

Cho Miyeon is a South Korean singer-songwriter, and actress under Cube Entertainment. She is best known as one of the main vocalists and visuals of the girl group (G)I-DLE.

In 2010, Miyeon became a YG Entertainment trainee. She was supposed to debut as a member of BLACKPINK's final lineup, however, suddenly left the company in 2015. She said that she left the company because her debut was always postponed, and she gave up waiting.

On April 8, 2018, Miyeon was revealed as the second member of (G)I-DLE. The group officially debuted on May 2 with their mini-album "I am" and the title song "Latata".

On October 26, 2018, it was confirmed that Miyeon would perform at the League of Legends World Finals Opening Ceremony 2018, along with Soyeon, Madison Beer, and Jaira Burns. The four singers provided vocals for the virtual K-pop girl group K/DA, with Miyeon voicing Ahri, one of the most well-known champions in the League of Legends.

In September 2020, it was revealed that Miyeon would make her acting debut as the female lead in web-drama "Replay: The Moment" as Yoo Hayoung, a popular YouTuber and band vocalist. The drama recorded more than 6 million cumulative views.

On April 27, 2022, Miyeon made her solo debut with her mini-album "MY", with "Drive" serving as the album's title track.
